194 rta rdzi|or {rta 'tsho mkhan}, one that tends horses; a groom. {rnal 'byor pa gong 'og 'di kun yang rta rdzi dang} also all the ascetics mentioned above and below with the horse-minder (A. 119).
194 sa dmar|red earth; {sa dmar 'bong} n. of small monastery called "Simon-bong" in the neighbourhood of Darjeeling situated on a mountain-slope which consists of red coloured soil (Hook. I.) (Jä.).
194 sangs rgyas pa|1. to attain to Nirvana. 2. SANST Buddhist, one believing or practising the religion of Buddha; {sangs rgyas pa'i grub mtha'} the religious doctrines of the Buddhists (Situ. 117).
194 sbon pa|+\n= {za ba} to eat.\n\n(EEE The headword in the original is {spon pa}, with the transliteration "sbon-pa". The transliteration is correct and the headword has been revised accordingly.)
194 sgab pa|1. secondary form of {'gebs pa}, to cover; covering: {bya mas bu la sgab pa} the covering of a young bird by its mother. 2. {gos sgab} skirt or lap of a coat; {sgab thung} a short skirt.
194 snum zan ma|one who eats dainty dishes; a glutton: {khyod la'ang gces phrug snum zan ma'i bags}({nyams}){shig yod} (may be) you have some petted child with the disposition of a glutton (A. 127).
194 snying nye ba|1. = {mdza' bo}, or {nye bo}, friendly, amicable, loving. affectionate. Figurative expression for it is {yid kyi ze'u 'bru} (Yig. k. 1). 2. dear and near relatives. 3. SANST money.
194 ti|1. represents num. fig. 39. 2. not originally Tibetan, designating water; has found its way into Ld. in {kha ti} saliva (water of the mouth) and {sna ti} water from the nose. 3. v. {spyi} Jä.
194 zhan|or {zhan pa} weak, feeble, the opp. to {drag po}. {khams zhan pa} of a weak body, of delicate health; also applied to sounds. In colloq. is used as opp. to {legs pa} well-looking, handsome.
195 bcing ba|1. bcio-ba and {bcings pa} are parts of {'ching ba} SANST, to bind. 2. sbst. bond, fetters (whether of a material, moral or magical nature); {zhags pas bcings} tied with rope (Situ. 75).
195 bcol bzhog pa|to entrust a thing to another's charge; {bcol gtam byed bzhag pa/} to settle about the trust; to entrust a thing to a person's charge (with an understanding): {bcol ltogs} = {byus}.
195 bka' chems|= {zhal chems} resp. for {kha chems} a great man's last will; a royal testament or will: {bka' chems ka khol ma zer sogs las/} in the work called Bkah-chems ka-khol-ma, etc. (J. Zao.).
195 brla|SANST the thigh: {brla sha} SANST, SANST muscular part of the thigh; {brla skyes} born of the (Brahma's) thigh, = {rje rigs}; {brla byung} (Moon.) the Vaisya or the gentleman caste of India.
195 de'u ra|(vulg.) {cung zad} 1. a little, almost: {nga de'u ra min na thog kha nas lhung ba yod} were it not for a little, I had fallen down from the roof. 2. acc. to Jä. one day, some future time.
195 grva sa|(ta-sa) a monastery; {grva sa chen po} (ta-sa chen-po) great departmental school attached to large monastery; {mtshan nyid grva sa zhig} a school where the Buddhist metaphysics is taught.
195 gtag pa|any species of white flowering rhododendron, all of which kind are held by Tibetans to be of the male sex. {gtag ma} red-flowering rhododendrons, which are considered to be female shrubs.
195 hu ru ru|has been explained as {mig hrig hrig lta ba} to stare at with the eyes fixed and not revolving (A. 136). {mig hu re 'dug} he stares, he gazes with wonder, horror, confusion (Mil., Glr.).
195 i|1. beer, = {chang} in C. 2. vulg. pronunc. of {dbyi} the lynx. 3. num.: 60. 4. in Budh.: {i ni mthong ba med pa'i sgo/} i is the invisible entity or it is symbolic of the same (K. g. {wa}, 43).
195 'jib rtse chen po|n. of a medicinal plant; it is said of it: {kha yi nad dang so dang mchin pa'i tshad pa sel bar byed} if cures inflammation of the liver and the teeth and diseases of the mouth.
195 kan na+ya kub dza|‡ (lit. the daughter of the hunchback) SANST, also written {kar na+ya'i yul}, a city in Ancient India, the capital of which was Kanya-kubja, the modern Kanouj (K. du. {da} 131).
195 khal ban|jug or pitcher to hold wine for 20 persons or a quantity measuring 20 {bre}: {dmangs chang khal ban re gang rigs} jugs of ale each sufficient for 20 of the vulgar folk of whatever class.
195 lhums|resp. for {mngal} SANST the womb: {lhums su 'jug pa} to enter the womb, conception; {lhums su zhugs pa'i dus mchod} religious festival to commemorate the time of the conception (of Buddha).
195 li thang|n. of a city and province in easternmost Tibet bordering China, where there is a large Buddhist monastery noted for containing blocks of the one hundred and eight volumes of the Kahgyur.
195 ljan ljin|SANST defilement, filth, dirt, dust, sweepings: {bag chags dri ma ljan ljin khrus kyis bkru ba'i phyir} for washing off by consecrated water the defilement and the mucus of lust (D.R.).
195 lug pa|I: 1. or {lug rdzi} sbst. shepherd, keeper of sheep. 2. to huddle heads together like timid sheep, to be sheepish in behaviour (Jä.).\n\n(EEE No definition II is provided in the original.)
195 ne le|1. SANST a species of harrier-hawk, prob. Circus melanoleucus which occurs in Tibet. Syn. {'ol ba} (Moon.). But in one author is stated to be equivalent to {bing kyur ma} the kite (Rtsii.).
195 ngang ring|or {ngang rgyud ring ba} forbearing; long-suffering; of cool nature: {don chen grub pa ngang ring /_byed dgos/} in accomplishing important business one should work with great patience.
195 nyag skyag|= {kho na} in Sikk. dialect: {gnang chang skyal chog pa zhig nyag skyag btang dgos} should only press the application to be permitted to send the Nao-chao (proposal-wine for marriage).
195 'phyan pa|+\n1. in {za zi'i 'khor lor 'phyan bzhin par} SANST (Yig. 122). 2. acc. to Jä. = {yan pa} to ramble, to range, roam about, wander, stray from; {'phyan te 'gro ba} to go wandering about.
195 rdo rje slob dpon|SANST; {sngags pa'i mkhan po} (Rtsii.) professor of the Mantra section in a monastery of the Tantrik school; also the lama of a monastery who is in charge of the Tantrik ritual.
195 ri bo gangs can|the Himavat (Himalaya) mountains.\n\nSyn. {kha ba'i lhun po}; {gangs ri dbang}; {dka' bzlog bla ma}; {me na'i bdag}; {ki la sha}; {ri'i rgyal po}; {bsel ri}; {gangs ldan} (Moon.).
195 rkang rtsa|resp. {zhabs rtsa} general name for shoes in Tsang. In Tibet the sole of a shoe is generally made of a kind of durable grass, hence the name {rkang rtsa}, foot-grass, signifies a shoe.
195 shad pa|or {gshad pa} and {gshod pa} to comb, to curry, (a horse), also {shar rgyag pa}. Also: to brush, to stroke, to rub gently with the hand in W. (Jä.). shad-ma curry-comb, horse-comb (Sch.).
195 sku gshen|the great teacher of the Bon: {'od zer dpag zhes bdag gi pha yag gzher sku gshen 'brom du gda'} "Hod-zer dpal was my father, I Sku gshen of Yag gsher am called Hbrom" (Hbrom. {kha} 22).
195 snga sha|= {rta sga'i snga ru} straps for binding things to a saddle; {phyi sha} the straps which go round the hind part, and called {sha btags sga'i snga sha la nad rkyal dang} (Lhamo bstod-pa).
195 thang ka|or {thang ga} 1. a plain, a flat field, alluvial plain. 2. resp. {zhal thang} a portrait, a painting; {thang sku} or {sku thang} a picture or representation of a deity on cloth or paper.
195 thur mgo|1. the tip of a spoon {thur mgo tsam} about the tip of a spoon, a spoon measure. 2. = {thur mgo} a halter; {thur thag} the rope attached to {thur mgo}; {thur mtha'} the end of that rope.
195 zhal bu|a small cup: {tho rangs gyi dus su skyo tshag bser ma mi skye ba zhal bu do drangs} at dawn they served me with two cups of pap, that air might not be generated (in the stomach) (A. 156).
195 zhar la|1. = 'following, succeeding' (Schtr.). 2. = {zhor la} on the occasion of, in connection with: {glang po blta ba'i zhor la na} SANST on the occasion of inspecting the elephant (A.K. 1-10).
195 zog po|or {zog ma} adj. deceitful, false, dissimulating: {btsun mo zog ma 'di} this deceitful lady; {yab chen zog ma ma bgyid mdzod} my lord do not play the hypocrite (Hbrom. {kha}, 19, 43, 112).
196 bar 'dum|= {bar bsgrig} agreement or treaty between belligerents: {bar 'dum zhig thub re} hoping to be able to bring about an agreement. {bar sdom} SANST [the suppression of the breath or voice]S.
196 bgro gleng pa|= {gros byed pa} to argue, discuss: {khong gi grva pa mkhas shig lha rje la bgro gleng byed du byung ste} one of his learned scholars having come to confer with Lharje (Deb. {ga} 8).
196 bi ra tsa na|‡ SANST 1. n. of the first Dhyani Buddha. 2. a learned lo-tsa-wa who flourished during king {khri srong lde'u btsan}'s reign and who first translated the Hbum from Sanskrit (Yig. 35).
196 bka' btags|+\n= {khrims bsgrags pa} 1. a proclaimed order: {khrims bsgrags pa} is also colloq. called {bkar btags}. 2. SANST one versed in drawing omens; an astrologer ({bka' gtogs pa}) (M.V. 61).
196 bka' gnang ba|vb., to order, command, grant, permit; an order; permission: {nged bod kyi rgyal po'i btsun mo la bka' gnang bar zhu} I beg you will give her as a consort to our King of Tibet (Jä.).
196 bsting tshig|or {bstings tshig} SANST satire, irony; also reflecting upon conduct in polite language; censure concealed under sweet language.\n\nSyn. {'phya tshig}; {tshig gis bstings} (Situ. 75).
196 bya rmyang ba|= {brkyangs shad byed pa} stretching one's self after fatigue, lying prostrate: {seng ge 'di tshang nas byung ste bya rmyang byed} this lion coming out of his den stretches his body.
196 'byong ba|pf. {byang} 1. to be cleansed, purified, v. {byang ba}. 2. to be skilled, well-versed, be full of: {rig byed la 'byor ba} versed in the Vedas; {las ka 'byong po} skilful work (Oag. 5-2).
196 char skyibs|a shelter, pent roof, protection from rain.\n\n(EEE The original gives the transliteration of the headword as "char-skyib", but the headword as shown is the usually accepted spelling.)
196 'dabs|rarely {'dab} the side, lateral surface (chiefly of the body); surface; {mchin 'dabs} the surface of the liver; {sgal 'dabs} the lumbar region; {nags 'dabs na} = {nags na} in the wood (Jä.).
196 dga' ba 'khyil ba|1. SANST the all-good; that exists by itself; the emblem of purity; purity typified. 2. n. of a gem. 3. the king's palace.\n\nSyn. {g.yung drung}; {rgyal po'i pho brang} (Moon.).
196 'dod pa ldan|1. wishing; a lustful person. 2. = {bya ngur pa} (Moon.).\n\n(EEE {bya ngur pa} does not appear as a headword in the dictionary but see under {mtshan mo 'bral} and {shing rta'i lus}.)
196 do lo|or {rdo la}: {do lo bzhu shel sngon mos byas pa} a necklace, a string made of pearls or precious stones (worn hanging down from the neck); an ornament hanging down from the shoulders (Jig.).
196 dum|1. a small plate or vessel: {dum gcig gtor mas bkang ba thogs nas} one plate filled with torma offerings (A. 29). 2. a small quantity, a little, a bit: {dum tsam sdod} wait just a short while.
196 dus tshigs|SANST season. {dus tshigs kun 'gro} = {bya 'jol mo} the jolmo bird (Moon.). {dus tshigs gsar ba} = {dus 'gyur ba} change of time, season; also fresh provision, produce of the year, etc.
196 gdong la ded pa|to push or press forward, to urge on, to haul a culprit before the judge; {snang ba gdong ded pa} to pursue one's course regardless of others (both in good and in bad sense) (Jä.).
196 glad|or {glad pa} SANST the head; brains; cf. {klad}: {glad la} on the top, on the head; also used as postposition in the sense of over, close over: {chu'i glad la} close above the river or water.
196 glag pa|+\n= {lhag pa} upper or back part or side: {mgo'i ltag pa} the crown or upper part of the head. Defined as {gri dang sta ri'i ltag pa}, the upper back part or blunt side of a knife or axe.
196 gnam lcags|SANST; resp. for {thog} the thunder: {gnam lcags rigs kyis bgegs 'joms smyo byed thub} with a kind of thunder was able to suppress evil spirits.\n\nSyn. {brgya byin mtshon cha} (Moon.).
196 gre'u|+ I: or {dre'u}, a young bear: {co ros gre'u gcig phul bas} Cho-ro having presented a young bear (A. 63).\n\nII: SANST pea, peas; {mon sran gre'u} a kind of pea growing in the Sub-Himalayas.
196 gril|(dil) (cf. {'gril ba}) a roll; {shog gril} rolled paper; a paper roll: {shog bus gril nas bzhag byung} kept rolled up in paper: {gos gril} a roll of satin or cloth; a garment folded up (Cs.).
196 gyod|v. {'gyod pa}.\n\n(EEE The original has the Tibetan headword as {gyad} but, with the transliteration "gyod" and the context, it is clearly a dropout error and has been corrected accordingly.)
196 gzhan don|SANST the interest or good of others: {sngon la rang don ma grub par gzhan don mi 'grub} unless (your) own interest has been first served you cannot look to other's interest (Behu. 249).
196 'jor|= {gzhor} 1. hoe, grubbing hoe, mattock, pick-axe; {'jor lcags} the iron of a mattock (Cs.). 2. the supine of {'jo ba} as in {'jor gyis rko ba} to turn up with the hoe; {'jor bu} a small hoe.
196 kang dang king|prop. n. of a terrific deity, a Dakini. When the monastery of Samye was built, the image of the {kang dang king} was placed on the first floor of the principal temple (Gyal. S. 87).
196 klan pa|1. revenge; wrong avenged; to wreak vengeance for: {bya rog gis 'ug pa la sha klan pa zhes pas len pa'i don/} (Lo. 9) the crow revenges itself upon the owl by what is called flesh-revenge.
196 kon pa|also called {kon pa gab skyes} the name of a plant that grows in solitary places, generally in the clefts of rocks. This medicine kon-pa gab-skyes, is used in Tibet for stopping hemorrhage.
196 mgo bo|= {yan lag mchog} SANST the chief of the limbs of the body (Moon.): {mgo bo gdugs 'dra zlum pa'i mi yi dbang por 'gyur} he who has a round head resembling an umbrella becomes a lord of men.
196 mi'i 'tsho ba|SANST human being, human existence, life.\n\n(EEE The original gives the transliteration of the headword as "mi-yi htsho-wa" or {mi yi 'tsho ba}with the same meaning as the Tibetan.)
196 mkhas pa'i mgul rgyan|mkhas pa'i mgul rgyan si tu chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi sum rtags kyi 'grel pa n. of a commentary on Tibetan grammar called {mkhas pa'i mgul rgyan} by Si-tu Chos-kyi hbyuo-gnas.
196 pho rog|colloq. for {bya rog} the raven, said to possess the power of foreboding; consequently omens are drawn from its cry. {pho rog mig} (lit. the raven's eye) n. of a medicinal herb (Vai. so.).
196 rang rkya thub|one who is so learned, clever or skilled that he needs no help or advice or instruction from another party: {nyams len rang rkya thub nges su zhun thar bcad pa de yin} (Khrid. 153).
196 ru ba|1. = {re gur} a tent-covering made of yak's hair; {ru ba pa} a person living in such a tent; {ru ba'i tshogs} a number of such tents, a tent-village (Jä.). 2. = {'brog pa} herdsmen of Tibet.
196 sa khra|= {sa kra} map; {sa khra 'degs} = {sa thig tshad blang ngo} draw a plan of the place (A. 61); {khyed rnams kyang jo bo'i sa khra bzhag nas} you also having left the Jo-wo's place (A. 123).
196 skyid sdug|good and ill-luck, happiness and misery; one's general circumstances: {skyid sdug ci byung kyang} whatever circumstances may happen: {skyid sdug bsre ba} pleasure and pain intermingled.
196 so sor thar pa|also {so sos thar pa} SANST, liberation, deliverance; {so so thar pa'i mdo} the Sutra on deliverance, code of moral and monastic discipline, containing 250 rules for the priesthood.
196 srog khung|1. the hole or passage through which life passes away. 2. the deep cut or stab, by which Tibetan butchers kill animals (Huc. 1. 443); {srog khung 'byed pa} to stab in this manner (Jä.).
196 sum cu tig|or {sum tig} a medicinal herb growing in the clefts of rocks and amidst grass in Tibet. {sum cu tig gis mchin mkhris tsha ba sel} removes inflammation of the liver and biliousness. Med.
196 tha ga na|occurs in the work {tha ga na'i mtshan brjod kyi 'grel pa la sogs pa gsang sngags} a commentary on the description of the names of Tha-ga-na and other terms of mysticism (Deb. {ga}, 27).
196 tha skar gyi bu gnyis|SANST the two sons of Ashvini who are divine physicians. {tha skar gyi zla ba} the month of Ashvina (October). {tha skar gyi nya} SANST the full moon in the mouth of Ashvina.
196 thib pa|v. {'thib pa} and {gtib pa}; {thib thib} very dark, dense; {smug pa thib thib} fogs thickening.\n\n(EEE {'thib pa} does not occur as a headword in the dictionary but see under {thibs po}.)
196 thug|postp. c. accus. until, up to; in reference to time and space {da thug} until now; {zhag bzhi bcu thug} for forty days; {dgon pa'i kha thug} over against the gompa, at the gompa. Adv. = only.
196 thur ma|1. SANST a stick, chopstick; {thur ma brgya pa} an umbrella which is made on a frame work of (lit. a hundred) many sticks (Moon.). 2. spoon. 3. a whole class of surgical instruments (Jä.).

197 cod pan|SANST, SANST, SANST, 1. tiara, diadem, crown worn by kings. 2. the crest of gallinaceous birds.\n\nSyn. {dbu rgyan}; {dpung rgyan}; {zla ba can}; {rtse gsum bgo rgyan}; {rtse bran} (Moon.).
197 dbang ldan|1. mighty, powerful. 2. a king sprung from the patriarch king of Tibet Ye-smon rgyal-po (J. Zao.). 3. a village in Tsang famous for carpet manufacture. 4. sym. fig.: eleven (Ya-sel. 54).
197 dbang sgo gsal pa'i cho ga|the rites or religious observances for making an object or person fit to be consecrated or ordained; {dbang gral} the row of those that are ordained or consecrated (Jä.).
197 gel pa|+\nthe trunk of a tree with a spiral top: {gel pa ni shing phung ngam rtsa ba sbom shing rtse mo rgyas pa} the term gelwa is when the stem or thick roots of a tree grow into a branching top.
197 'grangs pa|= {grod pa 'gengs} or {gsus pa 'gengs} bellyful, stomachful; {lto ba 'gengs} eaten to one's fill; also {ngoms pa} eaten to satiety; with {tshim pa} satiated; {chog pa} contented (Moon.).
197 'grim 'grul|communication; also travellers, either merchants or pilgrims: {rdo rje gdan du sog po'i 'grim 'grul chad} the communication of the Tartars with Dorje-dan (Gaya) was interrupted (A. 19).
197 gyis|1. instead of {kyis}, after the letters {na}, {ma}, {ra}, {la}. 2. imp. of {bgyid pa}, work honestly; behave well; do (so); {drang pur gyis} do it straight: {gyis shig} SANST do or let him do.
197 g.yon ma|1. the left hand (Jä.). 2. a woman: {bud med sgeg chos can} a woman who is possessed of seductive virtues; {g.yon mig ma} a term for a handsome woman (Moon.); a woman of captivating locks.
197 ka tya'i bu|‡ SANST lit. the son of Katya. It is said that the family name of Katyayana was given because the patriarch of the tribe took the vows of an ascetic from the sage Nada (K. d. {da} 127).
197 kha rje che|very powerful; also high moral merit: {'o skol ming sring rnams med na de ring rang kha rje che ang} if we brother and sister were not here, would you have been powerful today? (A. 18).
197 kun da|SANST 1. mistake, blunder, illusion (Lex.). 2. SANST, SANST the blue jessamine, Jasminum multiflorum or pubescens.\n\nSyn. {chu skyes}; {dgun zla tha chung skyes}; {'dab mo'i mdzod} (Moon.).
197 ldem pa|contrariety, opposition, irony. 2. adj. inconsistent, unstable, variable (Cs.). 3. vb. also {ldem ldem pa} (Sch.) to move up and down, to vibrate {gshog sgro ldem pa} the flapping of wings.
197 ma lag|1. active, quick. 2. in Ld. somersault; colloq. : {ma lag log byed pa} to perform a somersault, play the tricks of a mountebank, to roll on the ground with legs turned up, as do horses, etc.
197 ma reg|or {ma reg pa} = {ma thug pa} not touching or untouched: {chu'i dkyil 'khor la ma reg pa'i bar snang} the intermediate space which has not touched the clouds or sphere of water (Ya-sel. 39).
197 ngos zin pa|= {dngos zin pa} vb. 1. to be selfish. 2. = {ngos long} self interested: {de bas rang skyon ngos long gsal por shod/} there fore, clear of self-interest, confess your faults (Rdsa. 15).
197 no no|in Ladak a title of young noblemen; {no no chen mo} the eldest of a nobleman's sons, {no no bar pa} the second, {chung se} the youngest. In Khams is a favourite playful address to youngsters.
197 nor bu rin po che|SANST a mythical precious stone; further described as {nor bu rin po che rin thang med pa} the priceless gem in which lies the chief wealth and prosperity of the Chakravarti Raja.
197 paN chen|......{dpal ldan ye shes} the third Panchen Rin-po-chhe to whose court Warren Hastings in 1772 sent George Bogle. This lama made a grand progress from Shigatse to Peking; and died in 1779.
197 rked nad can ma|v. {bud med zla mtshan dang ldan ma}, a woman who has her monthly courses (Moon.).\n\n(EEE The original has {bud med zla mtshan dang ldan pa}, but this is a mistake for ~{ldan ma}.)
197 rong yul|the country of ravines; gen. Nepal, Sikkim, Bhutan, etc., are so called. {rong mi}, a man coming from Rong; {rong rta}, {rong lcang} a horse bred in, a willow growing in, Sikkim or Bhutan.
197 sbal pa can|SANST [a kind of tree, Sesbana grandiflora.]S. {sbal ba lag pa} the root of a medicinal plant: {sbal pa lag pas dri chu 'gag pa sel} the plant sbal-pa lag-pa cures obstruction of urine.
197 sbun gter|1. = {don med pa} or {snying po med pa} meaningless, without, substance, hollow, vain (Lish.). 2. a small building in the style of a monument, in which sacred writing are deposited (Jä.).
197 skya ris|outline, sketch, drawing of the outlines of a picture, which is generally done with charcoal in Tibet: {de nas skya ris 'di lta bu dgos} then outlines of this kind are necessary (A. 108.).

197 zhe thag pa|sincerity: {sems bskyed de zhe thag pa nas dgra bcom par 'gyur bar bya snyam na} if thinking that one should become a saint (Arhat) by sincerely imbibing faith in Buddhism (Surao. 123).

198 cho nge|or {cho nges} is explained as ({mig chu gtong ba}) shedding of tears (Moon.), lamentation, wailing, esp. lamentations for the dead, dirge; {cho ngas 'debs pa} SANST throwing up lamentations.
198 de ka|or {de kha} that, the very same; {gang zag de ka nga yin} that very person was I myself; {de ka ltar} just so; {de ka yod} (in answer to a question) indeed! that is so; {de ka lags} just that.
198 dong tse|or {dong rtse} SANST 1. a copper coin in China. 2. piece of money of small value either in silver, gold, or copper; {gser gyi dong tse} gold coin. {dong zil} in W. Corydalis meïfolia (Jä.).
198 dpe brjod|SANST (Moon.) 1. example, comparison: {dpe brjod pa'i tshul gyis} SANST by way or means of example; {dpe brjod byed pa} to compare, to cite an example. 2. paradigm, example in Gram. (Jä.).
198 dra ma|1. = {ya rabs} nobility, generally applied to the SANST Licchavi race of Vaisali. 2. experienced, practised, learned. 3. = {rtsi shing} a board or slate for counting and writing figures upon.
198 'dul ba'i sde|SANST the Dulwa or disciplinary part of the Kahgyur. {'dul ba'i gzhi} SANST the main principles of the Dulwa. {'dul ba 'dzin pa} SANST a Buddhist monk who observes the rules of Vinaya.
198 grod pa|or {gsus pa} belly; generally the paunch of ruminating animals; in colloq. language it is sometimes applied to the stomach or {pho ba}: {mar grod} butter kept in the dried paunch of a sheep.
198 grongs|+\n(dong), v. {'grong ba} resp. to die; {rang gi shi ba la zhes byas pa} is resp. for natural death.\n\n(EEE {'grong ba} does not occur as a headword in the dictionary but see under {grong}.)
198 khams bde|= {nad med pa} free from disease; health.\n\nSyn. {sku gzugs bde}; {nyer 'tshe med}; {nye zhos dben}; {gcong med}; {snyun med}; {nad bu med}; {'byung bzhi snyoms}; {bro mi 'tshal} (Moon.).
198 ku su lu pa|is a word of Tantrik mysticism, its proper Tibetan equivalent being {gcod pa}, the art of exorcism. The mystic Tantrik rites of the Avadhauts, called Avadhutipa in Tibet, exist in India.
198 las myur du byed pa'i ming|"terms signifying the quick performance of work," viz.: {myur du byed}; {mgyogs pa byed}; {rtab rtab}; {tur tur}; {rdzogs la khad}; {zin la khad}; {tshar la khad} (Moon.).
198 mdag pa|or {mdag ma} 1. = {me mdag} glowing embers, cinders. 2. a sort of large unburnt brick of mud or clay (Cs.); {mdag ma'i dong} a pit for keeping live coals (for the purpose of melting metals).
198 mgo zlum|or {mgo reg} SANST, SANST, SANST shaven head, also round bald-head; a Buddhist monk; {mgo zlum gnas} a place where the shaven heads reside; a monastery; {mgo zlum pa} a shaven head; a monk.
198 na gi|‡ SANST n. of a medicinal seed of the size and appearance of a pea, prob. a cubeb (Rtsii.) [lit. mountain-born]S.\n\nSyn. {nya phyis dung}; {rmig pa}; {ko la'i 'dab}; {mi rgan sen mo} (Moon.).
198 rgyal phran|a petty king; a feudatory prince.\n\nSyn. {rgyal rigs cha shas}; {yul 'khor dbang}; {yul gyi bdag po}; {grong khyer rje}; {sde dpon}; {sa yi thig le 'dzin}; {khams kyi rgyal po} (Moon.).
198 rlung bsreg|the musk-deer.\n\nSyn. {gla ba}; {gla rtsi can} (Moon.).\n\n(EEE the original has {rlung bsreg} rlung sreg; the transliteration is correct so the Tibetan has been corrected accordingly.)
198 skyi dkar|= {ko ba rtsi kha dkar po} the white fatty side of a skin (Oag.): {skyi dkar gyi pags pa} acc. to Cs., dressed leather; tanned leather, sometimes hide: {skyi dkar gyi pags shog} parchment.
198 tha mal pa|SANST ordinary, mean, coarse, vulgar, common, general, usual: {tha mal par 'dug pa} to live like the vulgar; {tha mal pa ma yin} that is no usual thing, no common or ordinary thing (Jä.).
198 thub|SANST; {blo thub pa} 1. capable; also sbst. a mighty one. {kun thub} one who is able to do everything, able to fight out all enemies (Yig. 124). 2. SANST a wise man, a sage, a saint in general.
199 a krong|(a-toong) a species of fern.\n\n(EEE the original has the headword as {a kro nga} but the two different transliterations given in the original indicate {a krong} which is the usual spelling.)
199 'ba' cha|sediment, lees, remnant: {snum brdung ba'i ro tho} the remnant of mustard when oil has been extracted or pressed out; {'ba' cha khal red 'bru} the cost of load of bah-cha is a Khal (Rtsii.).
199 ba dzra bo dhi|‡ n. of an Indian Buddhist, born in the country of Malaya, who visited China accompanied by his pupil Amogha Vajra during the reign of Emperor Ming Hung of the T'ang dynasty (Grub. 7).
199 bcin|v. {cin}.\n\n(EEE {cin} appears only at one other place in the dictionary, at {cin ci li}, but it is unclear if this is the intended reference. It may be an error for the common {gcin pa}, q.v.)
199 bre ga|or {bre gu} a plant producing small hairy berries which are used for medicinal purposes: {bre gas glo dang mkhal ma'i tsha ba sel} {bre ga} cures ailments of the lungs and heat in the kidneys.
199 'bubs pa|[pf. imp. {phubs}, fut. {dbub} to put on a roof, or some thing for a roof; {thog 'bubs pa} to make or construct a roof; {gur 'bubs pa} to pitch a tent; {gru phubs} corner pavilion S. g.] Jä.
199 chems|compounds: {kha chem} or {kha chems} resp. {zhal chems}, {bka' chems} farewell exhortation; last will, testament; {sras la kha chems 'jog pa} to deposit a testamentary disposal for a son (Jä.).
199 'dab|1. a train (of persons): {'khor 'dab} retinue (Cs.) 2. fold: {gnyis 'dab} = {lan gnyis} twice or two-fold. 3. SANST, SANST or {lo 'dab} a leaf, {yal 'dab} SANST a twig with leaves. 4. a feather.
199 dbu chos|or {dbu mdzad} title for the chief instructor in a monastery who begins every religious service and is the chief discipliner: {dbu chos la skal 'phar gcig} one share more for the {dbu chos}.

199 'gre ba|(de-wa) ({rigs lta bu}) SANST to roll one's self; {sa la 'gre ba} to roll on the ground; {'gre ldog} or {'gre log byed pa} to roll on the ground from pain or despair, &c.; also of horses, &c.
199 gres ma|1. the flashing lightning (Schtr.). 2. {dres ma} a kind of plant: {gres ma'i ge sar srin gsod glang thabs 'joms} the pistil of dres-ma kills worms and overcome the diseases called glao-thabs.
199 'khyor ba|SANST to be unsteady; to miss, fail; not to hit (Cs.); to reel, stagger, from intoxication; to warp (of wood or wooden vessels): {'gro na gom pa 'khyor} in walking his steps reeled (Rdsa.).
199 klung sgog|a kind of garlic growing wild on the margins of rivers in Tibet: {klung sgog mdze yi rma gso skrangs chu skem/} wild garlic cures leprous sores and dries up the fluids in swellings (Med.).
199 nye ba'i rin chen bdun|the seven secondary adjuncts of royalty:- (1) {lham} shoes, (2) {pags pa} skin-rug, (3) {gos} dress, (4) {mal} couch, (5) {tshal} grove, (6) {khyim} house, (7) {ral gri} sword.
199 pag|sometimes incorrectly for {spag} barley dough. {pag gu} (Dzl.); {pa'u} in Lh. brick; {phibs pag} roof-tile (Cs.); {wa pag} gutter-tile (Cs.); {rdza pag} or {so pag} (Glr.); {sa pag} (Glr.) (Jä.).

199 rta yi mjug ma|(lit. the horse's tail) n. of a medicinal plant.\n\nSyn. {g.yo ldan ma}; {zla ba'i lo ma}; {'dur byed skyes}; {yal ga'i me tog}; {mthon po ma}; {'gro ldan}; {bong bo'i me tog} (Moon.).

199 skyel mi|an escort: {lha sa nas skyel mi dgos rigs sngar rgyun ltar mi dpon nas gtong ba bcas bgyis/} should arrange for the escort (skyel-mi) of those formerly entitled to that privilege from Lhasa.

199 sne 'dzom|= {sna 'dzom pa} n. of fragrant plant burnt as incense: {bas ngal sa shing sne 'dzom dgos} for (the cure of) cow-itch I must have the Ne-dsom plant, the Ne-dsom plant is necessary (Rtsii.).

200 gzhog stegs|arch, playful, sportive: {gzhog stegs zhes pa ni kun tu rtse ba'o} being playful at all times is termed gshog-stegs (K. du. {ta}, 14); {gzhog stegs sgeg pa} to look in a coquettish manner.

201 sangs rgyas kyi zhing|SANST, SANST the fancied sphere of a particular Buddha or Bodhisattva; for instance Sukavati is the sphere of Amitabha Buddha, Tibet the chosen land of Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva.

201 stobs bskyed gsum|three producers of bodily vigour: {khrus byas 'o ma chu spyod sha_'phral du stobs bskyed gsum yin no/} (Can.) bathing, milk, the meat of the duck—these three quickly produce strength.
201 su su|who, who! {mi su su yod} what persons were there? 2. {su su zer ba} denotes the drawing in the breath in blowing up a fire, the lips being nearly closed, to prevent smoke from entering the mouth.
201 tshogs gnyis|1. SANST [two pursuits of life; viz.: religion, and wealth]S. 2. = {ye shes kyi tshogs} SANST the accumulation of learning and {bsod nams kyi tshogs} SANST the accumulation of moral merit.
201 zhus lo|nominal inquirer: {de yang chos zhus lo dang thob lo tsam gyis bstan pa'i sgor zhugs par mi 'gro} then even he did not go to learn religion nominally and to acquire it in name only (Khrid. 18).
202 ba lu|SANST species of fragrant arborescent plants (rhododendrons) growing in the Himalaya and Tibet the bark and leaves of which are used as incense by Tibetans; its flowers are called {da li} (Lish.).
202 bcag thag|taking care of (one's body, property, chattels, &c.): {ngag bkod ltar gyi bcag thag seng shor med pa byed/} according to (my) verbal direction take care (of the articles, &c.) without mistake.
202 bhe ka|‡ SANST; toad, corrupted into {sbe ka}: {mi gcer bur 'dzings pa} rugged naked person, {bhe ka'i tshil gyis mig sman byas na/} if the fat of the toad is made into eye-salve, etc. (K. g. {ca}, 56).
202 bru ba|v. {bkres pa}.\n\n(EEE The original has v. "{'kre ba}" but this is an impossible spelling. {bru ba} is cognate to {ltogs pa} which is cognate to {bkres} so the text has been altered accordingly.)

202 btus pa|1. = {bcus pa} SANST, SANST extracted, quoted. 2. {bdams pa} or {brtags pa} SANST; {rnam pa phye ba}. 3. {bsdus pa} or {mdor bsdus pa} abbreviated, concise, taken in short, in few words (Moon.).

202 bza' shing gi ra ba|SANST orchard, a grove of fruit-trees.\n\nSyn. {'bras ldan nags}; {rab dvangs btung ba}; {mchog gi tshal}; {dpal gyi kun dga' ra ba}; {ngal gso'i 'dun sa}; {skyo sangs gnas} (Moon.).
202 bzhengs pa|resp. of {lang ba} to rise, to get up: {sku}, {sku bzhengs gnang} pray, get up (from bed, etc.); {ma bzhang ma bzhang} don't get up, please; {stan las bzhengs} rises from the seat (Situ. 76).
202 bzhi shad|four strokes to imply a full stop {//__//} —or rather two at the conclusion of a period and two at its beginning: {don tshan chen mo rdzogs pa dang /_le'u'i mtshams su bzhi shad dgos} (Situ.).
202 cha bsags pa|lit. many parts or particles accumulated together ({sa gzhi dang ri'i ming rdul gyi cha bsags pa}) 1. a term signifying the earth; a mountain. 2. SANST the capital of the fabulous Sambhala.
202 cha dkar|n. of a district in Lhokha, in Tibet. {cha dkar srang} n. of the junction of several public roads in Chakar, {cha dkar du cha dkar srang gi bal} in Chakar the wool (sold at) Chakar cross-roads.

202 mu khyud 'dzin ri|SANST, SANST n. p., one of the seven fabulous golden mountains surrounding Sumeru, and it is so called: {mu khyud du gyur pas} because it lies on its verge or circumference (Sorig. 8).
202 pad gling|a Buddhist sanctuary consecrated to Padma Sambhava; {shar lho mtshams na sbas yul pad ma gling} on the south-east boundary is the hidden country Pad-ma-glin, i.e., Sikkim (K. thao. {ka}, 168).

203 dus 'khor paN Di ta|n. of celebrated lama born in Mongolia who was recognised as an incarnation by the Emperor of China. He founded the monastery of Pad-dkar cho-glio now harbouring three thousand monks.

204 lnga drug 'gro|in Tibet when one borrows grain he has, as a rule, to give back one measure more for every five measures he had taken. This is called the payment—six for five measures of agricultural loan.

206 gru 'dren|SANST, defined as {gru nang du 'jug pa'i skye bo'i ming}, person conveyed in a boat. People who journey by boat are:- {mgron po} guest; {don mthun} merchant, trader; {gru la zhon} boat passengers.
206 gu ling|1. pure gold picked out from a mine. 2. also spelt {gu gling}, gold embroidered cloth or silk: {gu gling gi chos gos gcig phul nas} having presented a religious garment of embroidered silk (to him).
206 legs pa'i skar ma|n. of a Bhikshu who had served for about twenty years and committed to memory twelve volumes of Sautranta works and is said to have attained the fourth stage of Dhyana (K. my. {kha}, 288).
206 me tog sgron|lit. the flower-lamp; one of the names of {tshe spong bza'} wife of king {khri srong lde'u btsan} who was mother of princes Mu-khri btsan-po, Mu-rug btsan-po and Mu-tig btsan-po (Loo. {'a}, 8).
206 nam mjug 'chad ka|or {nam gzhug 'chad ka} SANST the end of autumn and beginning of winter: {nam gzhug 'chad ka'i me tog ldum ra ltar} like a garden of flowers of the days preceding the winter season (A. 6).
206 'og ma|SANST adj. the lower, later, following one. Said to = {dman pa}, i.e. {de'i 'og ma} the one following after that, the second in turn, one below or under another person, subordinate, inferior (Moon.).
206 pan pon|not considered perfect in dignity, as for instance the lamas of Lahoul that are married (Jä.).\n\n(EEE The original gives the transliteration of the headword as "pan-bon" ({pan bon}) for {pan pon}.)
206 'phros|(from {'phro ba} q.v.) = {lhag lus} residue (Situ. 114), excess of what is actually required, remainder, balance; {'phros 'os kyang 'tshal} grant me that residue, let me have the remainder (Yig. k.).
206 ra gur|= {ra ba} an enclosure with rail, wall or fencing; {rdo rje ra gur} an enclosure made with walls or pillars having Dorje figures on them (Yig.)—the monastery of Samye has such an enclosure around it.
206 rme bad|n. of a very old monastery in Lhasa in front of which a stone monolith was erected bearing the inscription of a treaty between the king of Tibet {khri ral pa can} and the Emperor of China (J. Zao.).
206 rngod pa|pf. {brngos}, fut. {brngod}, acc. to Cs. and Jä. {brngo}, imp. {rngod} or {rngos}. 1. to parch (barley, wheat, or rice); to bruise; to roast; to fry, e.g., meat in a pan. 2. acc. to Cs. to deceive.
206 rtogs brjod|or {rtogs pa brjod pa} SANST lit. discriminative speech, the utterance of what is fully grasped; a common designation for the recital of the events of an ideal life, full of instructive lessons.
206 sgro 'dogs|(do-dög) doubts; {sgro 'dogs gcod} free from doubts: {bla ma dam pa'i gdams ngag gis nang gi sgro 'dogs gcod pa yin} by the (upadesha) precepts of the holy Lama his doubts were dissolved (A. 77).
206 sha rtsi|= {sha mdog} complexion, colour of the skin: {bram ze'i bu mo sha rtsi ser ba} (Hbrom. {kha}, 34) the Brahman's daughter of fair complexion.\n\n(EEE The original has Brahman's for Brahman's above.)
206 snang brgyad pa'i rab klung|an epithet of the river Gaoga: {gsung mchid kyang snang ba brgyad pa'i ral klung bzhin stsol ba khyen khyen/} pray let your kind letters flow (to me) like the Gaoga (Yig. k. 36).
207 bkag skor med pa|= {'gor gzhi med pa} without delay, as in sending anything; also without let or hindrance; {bkag bgegs rgyas 'gebs} not permissible and permissible, not fit and fit, unbecoming and becoming.
207 bkra shis dung|= {dung dkar g.yas 'khyil} SANST a conch shell with its whorls turning to the right instead of to the left (Moon.).\n\nSyn. {dung mchog}; {skye ba lnga pa}; {rgyal po 'khyil ba} SANST (Moon.).
207 'bras bu rtag par 'dod pa'i lta ba|a doctrine in which the fruit of one's Karma is always desired. {rgyu mi rtag ste sems dngos por med/_'bras bu rtag gru phyu 'am dbang phyug yod nges zer ba'o/} (Theg. 33).
207 'byol ba|pf. and imp. {byol}, fut. (and prest. in C.), {dbyol} = {nur ba} to give or make way, {lam 'byol ba} = to turn out of the way, to step aside; {'byol te 'gro} in walking I make way (to people) (Jä.).
207 chan|I: ({dpe la chan lta bu}) SANST a marginal note or foot-note to explain the meaning of a term or expression in the text.\n\nII: soap, mash, pulp, etc.; {'bras can} rice-pap; {nas chan} barley-pap (Jä.).
207 chen po|SANST, SANST, SANST, SANST, SANST great, large, chief; {mi chen po} a great man; {bla ma chen po} a great lama. Sometimes {chen mo}: {gsung gi gzungs 'bum chen mo} a huge jar containing magic spells.
207 dar po che|v. {dar lcog} sail; large flag fastened to a flag-staff: {rdzings de yar dar po che rlung gis bskyod pa bzhin du 'dar ba dang} and that ship quivered like as a flag when moved by the wind (A. 16).
207 dbang thob pa|to get power, to be powerful: {shang po'i bu sman chen po blon por bcug na dbang thob par 'gyur ro} (K. du. {da}, 261) if you appoint Sman-chen-po the son of Sao-po he will rise to great power.
207 dva las bA dur|the Mongol name of the son of king Mi-wao Phola Bsodnams Stob-rgyas. His real Tibetan name was Hgyur-med Rnam-Rgyal, and the Emperor of China conferred on him the title of Wang (Loo. {'a} 18).
207 gru 'dzin|SANST, SANST 1. n. of a mountain in the south of India; also the residence of Avalokitesvara on the small island of Puto off Shanghai; n. of the residence of the Grand Lama at Lhasa. 2. an harbour.
207 gson ma|colloq. for {gson po}: {phug ron gson ma} a live pigeon; {gson gshin} the living and the dead (Cs.); {gson bsreg} a creature burnt alive; {mi zhig la gson bsreg byed pa} to burn a person alive (Jä.).
207 gya|num. used in the abbreviated form, in the place of {brgyad cu} 80; {gya gcig} 81; {gya gnyis} 82; {gya gsum} 83; {gya bzhi} 84; {gya lnga} 85; {gya drug} 86; {gya 'dun} 87; {gya brgyad} 88; {gya dgu} 89.
207 g.yer kha|or {dril bu g.yer kha ma} small bell attached to the neck of a Lhasa lap-dog as an ornament.\n\n(EEE The original gives the transliteration of the headword as "gyer-kka" which is clearly in error.)
207 gzhal 'khor|and {gzhal thag}; {gzhal thim}; also {gzhal phul} SANST; {gzhal 'phyos} SANST; {gzhal gzhi}, {gzhal yal}; {gzhal lad}, {gzhal sangs}; all seem to be names of numbers ({grangs gnas}) (Ya-sel. 57).
207 gzhes pa|1. to be well, to prosper: {'tsho zhing gzhes pa} enjoying life, passing it in prosperity (Yig. k. 2). 2. acc. to Jä. is resp. for to sit, stay, wait: {cung tsam cung tsam gzhes shig} wait a little.
207 khab len rdo|SANST load-stone; the metal that attracts a needle: {khab len rdo yis mde'u 'byin klad rus rtsa nad sel} the load-stone draws out arrow-heads and removes diseases of the brains, bones and veins.
207 kha 'cham|= {kha mthun}. {kha 'cham pa} = {kha mthun pa} or {kha thug pa} to agree upon; {kha 'cham khrugs} = {pho mo lhan cig tu gnas pa} residing together as husband and wife; to live harmoniously (Moon.).
207 klu yi lce|= {thal dres sman} lit. the snake's tongue; n. of a plant used in medicine.\n\nSyn. {sngo sangs 'khri shing}; {sngo sangs mtha' yas}; {mtha' yas rtsa}; {ba glang bsrung}; {me tog phra mo} (Moon.).
207 ko tra pa|SANST, SANST, in vulg. Nepalese Kodu, a kind of millet largely used in Sikkim for making murwa beer; it is mentioned in K. d. {ra} 333. A species of grain eaten by the poor; Paspatum scrobiculatum.
207 krab krab|(tab-tab) = {'khrab pa} dancing or stamping of the feet: {rkang lag krab krab bro 'khrab pa} (his) legs and arms moved as in dancing. According to Oag. {krab krab} is equivalent to {leb leb}, flat.
207 la lo la mor|= {rim gyis rim gyis} gradually, by degrees; {sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la lo la mor 'jig pa'i rtags yin gsungs} he said that it was a sign of the gradual decay of the religion of Buddha (A. 49).
207 ma thal|restraint in speaking, in running, racing, etc. {khyod kyis de drag cang ma thal lam} have you been unassuming in power, rank, etc. (Rdsa. 21). {ma thal bar gyur} SANST not gone beyond, not exceeded.
207 mchad pa|SANST 1. tomb, sepulchre. 2. {mchad par bya ba} SANST greatness; also the magical power of increasing one's size at will. 3. acc. to Jä. SANST killed, slain; but {mchad pa med pa} = entire, perfect.
207 me lha mo|SANST the quarter of fire, south-east: {shar lho me lha'i phyogs su thab tshang bya} make (your) cooking-hearth in the south-east corner of the house which is the quarter of the god of fire (Jig.).
207 mgar rtsan gnya' ldom ba|n. of the celebrated minister Gar of Tibet, who was sent to China to negotiate for the marriage of the daughter of emperor T'ang Tai-tsung with his master king {srong btsan sgam po}.
207 nag po 'gro shes|= {yi ge go bde ba bris pa} a clear legible writing, writing very clearly (Rtsii.). {nag po 'gro bsher} was explained to Jä. as illustrating a sentence by comparing it with similar passages.
207 nang gcig|= {sdod gcig} also {nyin gcig} one day, one morning: {nang gcig khang pa'i thog mtshams jo bo bzhugs pa'i thad ka} {/} one morning he went towards the edge of the roof of Atisa's residence (A. 27).
207 ngal stegs|I: a rest; a sort of wooden crutch to support a load on the back while resting in a standing posture.\n\nII: or {ngal tshugs} a bench or seat inviting repose.\n\nSyn. {bsti ba}; {sdod pa} (Moon.).

207 sang phod|= {sang lo} next year; {sang phod da tsam du} a year hence, about this time next year: {yang sang phod lo dus na mu stegs pa'i ston pa} next year the Tirthika teacher about this time again (A. 33).

207 thab lha|the deity presiding over the hearth. If milk or broth boil over, he must be appeased by casting butter in the fire; and, often, by more elaborate ceremonial, sometimes even by digging up the hearth.
208 bgod ra|apportionment; share: {nang zan gtan sdod rnams la snyoms brdad yeng yong ba'i bgod ra byed} divide everything (that is left over) equally among the permanent residents of the family, &c. (Rtsii. 61).
208 bha len tra|‡ SANST the country Varendra (North Bengal): {shar phyogs bha len tra na mu stegs kyi lha rten mang po yod} in the eastern quarter in Bhalentra there were many Buddhist images and symbols (A. 60).
208 da lis|‡ (prob. from SANST) same as {ba lu'i me tog} a species of dwarf rhododendron with fragrant leaves: {da lis bad kan grang ba sel zhing tshe bcud len} Dali cures phlegm, gonorrhoea, and gives longevity.
208 'di pa|SANST man of this place; this man; {'di pa'i gdong} from this man's face, i.e., from the lips of this man. Colloq. {'di pa} is a common word for here; kha-sang di-pa lep-song he arrived here yesterday.
208 dkar bcud gsum|the triple white elixir, i.e., the cream from the milk of the female yak, ewe, and cow: {'bri lug ba gsum gyi 'o ma 'dus pa'i khaN Da} "Khanda is the mixed milk of the female yak, ewe and cow."

208 ka chug|so, like that, accordingly; {ka chug mdzod} means {de ltar byed} do like that, do accordingly: {a mes mi spro na mi byed du ka chug mdzad/} "If Ame is disinclined, let (him) not do like that" (A. 94).
208 kha gshags|= {kha rtsod} using rough language; controversy, discussion, dispute; with rgyag-pa to dispute: {'dzub mo bsgrengs te kha gshags rgyag tu 'gro_/} pointing his fingers he goes to dispute (Rdsa. 17).
208 kha zas|food, either in general or some particular article of food: {kha zas la brkam par gyur} he longed for food; {kha zas gtsang ma} clean food, or clean in (taking food). In Sikk. khabze sweet cakes, etc.
208 'khyog 'gro|1. = {gza' spen pa} the planet Saturn or {gos sngon}; he in blue robe (Moon.). 2. = {'bab chu} a stream; waterfall (Moon.); {sbrul 'byog 'gro} the snake because it creeps in a bent course (Moon.).
208 kya la|(also called {rgya la}) petty; n. of a petty state in Tibet, the chief town of which is {rgya la seng gdong} (lit. the lion-face), where the Tsang-po, it is said, enters a rocky chasm in the mountains.
208 lha ldan|n. of the city of Lhasa; it is also called {lnga ldan} SANST because containing in its grand monastery five miraculously sprung images {rang byon lnga ldan gtsug lag khang der yod pa} (Loo. {'a}, 6).
208 mi rang|or {mi hreng} a man walking on foot without any load to carry: {de nas bal po rdzong la 'gro tsa na mi rang zhig dang phrad} on reaching the capital of Nepal he met with a solitary traveller (A. 129).

208 rkun po|fem. {rkun mo} SANST, SANST, a thief, a robber.\n\nSyn. {jag pa}; {g.yos ma}; {yan lag ngan}; {ar pa}; {'jab bu pa}; {chom rkun}; {gzhan dung}; {mtshams kyi byed po}; {'og tu rgyu}; {chom po} (Moon.).
208 sbed ma|1. any property or article that is hidden not made public; concealed treasure that has come to light. 2. SANST the veiled woman, n. of a wife of Buddha, which name is also translated as {sa 'tsho ma}.
208 sbe ga|= {sbe kha} {lus kyis rtsal sbyong} physical exercises, athletics, etc. {sbe ba} to scuffle, to wrestle; sbe-kha = {ab tang rtsid pa} or {rdab re byed pa} trial of strength between combatants (Rtsii.).
208 sgron shing|or {sgron me shing} the yew-leaf fir, Pinus picea; in Sikkim Pinus longifolia is so called. {sgron shing pang rlung chu ser grangs ba sel} sgron-shio removes mucous, wind, and cold in the stomach.
208 shing rta bcu pa|SANST n. of the king of Ayodhya whose son was Rama, the hero of the epic Ramayana. {shing rta bcu pa'i sras} son of Dasaratha, i.e., king Rama, the vanquisher of Ravana king of Laoka (Moon.).
208 skrang ba|SANST, SANST pf. {skrangs} to swell; {skrang song} it is swollen: {glo bur mtshon dang rdo dang dbyug pa sogs phog nas skrangs} swollen from being suddenly struck with a stick or a stone or a sword.
208 so sor skye bo|SANST; prop. one separated (from the saints), one distinct from incarnate beings, an ordinary man; a lay man; as to his spiritual condition: a man in his natural state, one not yet enlightened.
208 spru ba|or {spru ma} hellebore; {spru dkar} white species of it. {spru bas gnyan tshad srin dang /_mdze nad 'joms shing khrag shong gcod} hellebore cures plague, fever, worms and leprosy, also stops bleeding.
208 thog ma skyes|I: SANST the first born (of brothers and sisters); the eldest brother.\n\nSyn. {sngon skyes}; {jo jo}; {phu bo}; {a jo} (Moon.).\n\nII: the first born (of Brahma), i.e., Brahmana caste of India.
208 'tshar ba|1. = {tshad longs pa} or {'dangs pa} up to the mark, sufficient; in proper measure. 2. to be finished, completed, spent; esp. as an auxiliary to denote an action that is perfectly past or completed.
208 ya nga|or {ya nga ba} 1. repentence. 2. anguish, fright, shuddering, with genit. or accus. of that which is the cause of it; {ya nga ba'i dmag tshogs} a formidable host; {ya nga'i gegs} terrible danger (Jä.).
208 ze tshva|saltpetre (S. g.); {ze tshva can} containing saltpetre, nitrous: {ze tshvas rde'u rdo skron ba shig par byed} nitre absorbs stone and fetid matter in the bladder. {ze tshva'i skyur rtsi} nitric acid.
208 zhal byang|resp. for {kha byang} title, superscription, inscription: {khri lde srong btsan dus kyi zhal byang brag la brkos} the inscription of the time of Khri-lde-sroo-btsan was engraved on rock (Situ. 23).
208 zur tsam|SANST slight mention, a hint: {zur tsam gyi go pa} SANST one who perceives from a slight hint or sign; {zur tsam bsdu ba} to abridge, to shorten; {zur tsam bsdus pa} compendium, abridgment (S. Lex.).

209 brgya byin grong|SANST the residence of Indra; the celestial metropolis.\n\nSyn. {'chi ba med ldan}; {lta na sdug}; {sum cu rtsa gsum}; {khang bzang rnam par rgyal ba}; {rnam par rgyal byed pho brang} (Moon.).
209 'bru ba|or {bru ba}, pf. and imp. {brus}, to pry into, scrutinise; to probe, and fig. to inflame and irritate: {mtshang 'bru ba} to spy out faults, also to irritate, {mtshang 'bru ba'i tshig} irritating words.
209 btub|1. {rung} fit, becoming; convenient, practicable: {phyi rol pa dang rtsod pa mi 'ong bas btub} (A. 33) it is proper not to have controversy with outsiders (unbelievers); {ma btub po} it is not convenient.
209 dar dpyangs|or {dar yug} SANST a narrow ribbon-like piece of silk, a kind of silken ornament. 2. the silk carves or coloured cotton cloth attached to a flag-staff (Rtsii.).\n\nSyn. {dar bu}; {dar chung} (Jä.).
209 dbu rgyan|SANST, SANST, SANST ornament of the head, diadem, tiara.\n\nSyn. {gtsug rgyan}; {gtsug gi rin po che}; {gtsug gi nor bu}; {spyi bo'i rgyan}; {cod pan}; {phrog zhu}; {rtse phran}; {mgo rgyan} (Moon.).
209 dkor ma 'bags|not misappropriating the treasures, stores, etc., of the church: {skom du chang gsol dge 'dun dkor ma 'bags/} do not take wine for drink nor embezzle the property of the priesthood (Kathao. 115).
209 gangs can|SANST 1. one of the native names of Tibet. 2. abounding in snow; snowy; full of glaciers: {gangs can las 'byung ba'i chu} the water issuing from a glacier: {gangs can gyi skad} the language of Tibet.
209 'gog ku|prob. derived from the Chinese, signifying the goddess of the elements. Acc. to the Chinese the fundamental elements are tree, fire, earth, iron, and water. Each of these is presided over by a goddess.
209 g.yar po|1. anything borrowed, taken as a loan, a loan: {lus 'di 'byung bzhi'i g.yar po yin} this is a loan of the four (constituent) elements (Hbrom. {kha}, 108). 2. credit for what has been lent or advanced.
209 'jur gyis|suddenly, all at once: {na bza'i phag na tshur dngul gyi maNDal khru gang pa zhig 'jur gyis bton} from the pocket of his robe he suddenly drew forth a silver mandal tray one cubit square (Hbrom. 14).
209 klas|SANST copious, abundant; an equivalent of {yas}, beyond, apart, as in {'byams klas} or {mtha' klas} (SANST). In this case {klas} may be taken to mean "without," and is an equivalent of the Sanskrit SANST.
209 krog krog|(tog-tog) a kind of sound produced by the grinding of hard or brittle objects together: {krog krog ni sgra skad} "tog-tog is a sound" (Oag.); tog-tog is an onomatopoetic word meaning a grating sound.
209 ku shu|a kind of lime; a kind of fruit; an apple (Jä.); {ku shu shing} apple tree; {ku shu 'bras bus rgyu long khyog 'khrugs gzer ba 'joms/} the fruit of Ku-shu cures griping and acute pains in the intestines.
209 lcags thal|SANST oxide of iron obtained, red-hot iron being repeatedly dipped in the urine of cows, &c. {mchin dug dmu rdzing skem pa'i mchog/} iron-ash is the best remedy for liver disease, poison and dropsy.
209 ma tu lung ka|‡ n. of a plant: {ma tu lung ka'i khu ba bu ram dang 'tungs nges par byas na zug rngu sel bar byer do} the juice of Matuluoka mixed with molasses would remove pain from the body (K. g. {ca}, 47).
209 mchor po|sometimes also {'phyor po} 1. pretty, handsome, neat, elegant; {pho mchor po} a handsome man; {bud med mchor mo} a pretty woman, esp. a smart gaily-dressed female. 2. in W. also vain, conceited (Jä.).
209 nabs so|SANST n. of the sixth constellation in Buddhist astrology. {nabs so skyes} one born under the constellation of Punarvasu, an epithet of Virnu (Moon.).\n\nSyn. {sbyin ma'i lha mo}; {rgyal stod} (Moon.).
209 pha tshe|= {rgyab khug} a bag, a sack, alms-bag carried by mendicants; {thang ga}({sku thang}){pha tshe tsam zhig la dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas} inside a bag there was a picture of the Buddhas of the three ages.
209 ra yig|SANST, SANST the letter {ra} when surmounting another letter is so called. {ra yig gnyis pa} SANST = {sbrang ma} a name for the bee on account of its horns, resembling the double {na ro} {au} (Yig. k.).
209 rdo rje pha lam thog kun bzlog par byed|(EEE The original gives the transliteration of the headword as "Rdo-rje phal-lam thog kun brjog pao-byed" which has three errors in it. The original Tibetan is correct.)
209 rgyal ba'i rgyal tshab|= {rgyal ba rin po che'i sku tshab} the Regent of Tibet who administers the country during the minority of the Dalai Lama; now called Rgyal-tshab Rin-po che or Bod-Rgyal-po (Pö-gye-po.).
209 rngan can|or {rngan chen} SANST, SANST jeering; disdain: ({ngan pas rngan can byed du'ang 'ong}) the evil hearted also came to scoff at him (Hbrom. 37).\n\nSyn. {brnyas pa}; {tsho khyad}; {khyod tsho} (Moon.).
209 sbug pa|to penetrate, to perforate, to pierce into: {sbug rtsa lon pa} = {nang gi rgyu rkyen ha go ba} to understand the secret of any matter, to penetrate into the real object or import of anything (Yig. k.).
209 skam phogs|allowances or wages of an officer or inferior servant in barley-flour, tea or coin, etc., but not cooked food; {gzhung gi ngag don skam phogs} according to Government order; dry allowance (J. Zao.).
209 so 'dzin|= {mtshams 'dzin} 1. occupying the confines of a country or region. {rgya bod gnyis kyi bar gyi so 'dzin pa'i gnas} (A. 152) a place for guarding the boundaries between Tibet and India. 2. {mchu} lip.
209 them deb|registration or record of the thresholds of houses with a view to levy house-tax: {mi ser sde grong them deb nang gsal} a statement or list of tenants, villages and towns is set forth herein (Rtsii.).
210 ban skya|‡ ({ban} = {ban de} a Buddhist monk or priest, {skya} = a layman) {spyir ban skya thams cad skyabs 'gro la bkod pas} compelled all the priests and laymen in general to take refuge in Buddhism (A. 103).
210 gshol|= {thong} or {thong gshol} SANST, SANST, SANST plough, the plough in Tibet consisting only of a crooked beam called {gshol mda'} SANST (without wheels) and the share called {gshol lcags} or {thong lcags}.
210 gyi na'i g.yang|= {snyoms las pa} or {las ka cher ma thub pa} state of inactivity, idleness: {log chos thams cad gyi na'i g.yang la bskyur} threw all heretical doctrines into the abyss of inaction. , (A. 158.).
210 g.yo 'gul|quaking, trembling, shivering. {g.yo 'gul chen po} great quaking.\n\nSyn. {g.yo zhing 'gul}; {'dar zhing ldeg}; {yom yom}; {shig shig}; {sig sig}; {yongs su 'gul}; {'khrugs}; {kun tu 'khrugs} (Moon.).
210 ker leb sgur|SANST metaph. for horse, sheep and yak: {ker leb sgur gsum gyi nang nas ker sgur gyi 'bab/} the tax (in kind, i.e., one in a hundred) on horse and yak from among the three kinds of cattle (Rtsii.).
210 khram khrum|fragments; baked fragments: {sa phag la par brgyab nas me la bsregs pa de khram khrum brdungs te bskol} (raw) brick containing prints or engravings thereon when burnt are said to be baked fragments.
210 khrig khrig|(thig-thig) 1. proper, suitable; not less nor more: {khrig bsgrigs song} it has suited well; it fits exactly. 2. quivering, as of the body with cold, or chattering of the teeth. 3. v. {khrib khrib}.
210 khyad chos|superior or excellent doctrine; a good religious discourse, hence those who possess special qualification for miracles are called {gzhan las khyad par du 'phags pa} "in sublimity superior to others."
210 'khyog po'i sde|= {po son cha}, {chang rtsi} a kind of churn or mixer to make wine with.\n\nSyn. {gong bu can}; {gser gyi lag}; {dbugs 'byin shing}; {chang shing}; {lag pa'i tshong dus}; {khyos byed} myos-byed.
210 klu mo mu tig nu zho can|n. of medicinal plant used for wounds or sores. Its flowers are of garnet colour; when they are plucked there oozes out a milkish sap which is said to possess healing power (Sman. 350).
210 lhun po|SANST; heap mountain, hill, upheaval; {ri rab lhun po} the mountain Sumeru. {bkra shis lhun po} "Tashi-lhunpo" SANST heaps of glory, auspicious events or things; n. of the great monastery near Shigatse.
210 ltams pa|pf. {bltams}, fut. {ltams} 1. to be full, also {gtams pa}. 2. SANST resp. to be born; {skyed pa'i yab dang bltams pa'i yum} the father by whom one is begotten, and the mother by whom one is born (Jä.).
210 mi kha|mi yi kha thoughtless and irresponsible advice of the people, common talk: {yul sde'i nang nas mi kha sdud} in the whole neighbourhood one is an object of gossip; defaming talk—with or without {ngan pa}.
210 mno ba|+\n= {sems pa}, pf. {mnos} to think over, ponder, imagine: {de nga la zer ba yin mnos nas} thinking it had been said to me. {bsam mno gtong ba} = {bsam blo gtong ba} to consider, to think carefully upon.
210 mtho ngag|= {mtho bshad} grandiloquence, high speech with little meaning. {chos rgyal de'i dus kyi lta ba mtho ngag yin te} the doctrines of the time of that Buddhist king were only high-flown theories (A. 77).
210 'phangs pa|1. shaken, thrown, cast out ( = {bskyod pa}), pf. of {'phen pa} (Moon.). 2. frq. for {phangs pa} to spare, to save (Dzl.); {'phangs med gtong sems ldan} liberal, bounteous, without restriction (Jä.).
210 rtsigs ma|grounds, tea-leaves, sediment, the turbid matter of a decoction; and thus in gruel made of barley the fluid portion is called {dvangs ma} and the thick sediment is called the {rtsigs ma} of the gruel.
210 shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan|one of the five treatises said to have been composed by Aryasaoga under inspiration from Maitreya Bodhisattva (Tan. d. {ka}).
210 sos ka|SANST, SANST the summer season. {sos ka tsha ba'i dus} the hot season, from about the middle of April till the middle of June.\n\nSyn. {tsha gdung can}; {tshad can}; {nges sreg}; {drod 'ong dus} (Rtsi.).
210 tha'i dzi|(Mongolian) the title by which the descendants of Jenghis Khan the great Tartar conqueror are known. According to Mongol law the fact of one's bearing the title of Thahi-dsi exempts one from taxation.
210 ti liM ga|‡ the modern Telingana, the birth place of the Buddhist sage and author Dignaga: {dpal phyogs kyi glang po'i 'khrungs sa ti liM ga zer yod pa} there is Tailinga the birth place of Sri Dignaga (Dsam.).
210 'tshog pa|pf. {btsags}, fut. {btsog}, imp. {tshog} 1. to hew, chop, strike; to inoculate; 2. vaccinate, to find fault with, to blame, censure, teaze (Sch.).\n\nEEE The imp. form above is mistaken. It is {sogs}.
211 bco ba|pf. and imp. {bcos}, prop. root of the fut. tense of {'chos pa}, but in W. the usual word for {byed pa}, to make, perform; to prepare, manufacture, construct. It is employed in all kinds of phrases (Jä.).
211 byab pa|pf. {byabs pa} 1. to cleanse, wash, wipe: {nang thams cad la byab pa} to clean the whole house. 2. to seize, clutch: {ra lug byab nas a lce wa mos za} seizing the goat and sheep, the fox eats them, alas!
211 dbang rta brgyad|= {rta mchog brgyad} the eight miraculous horses near Lake Mapham seen in a vision by the son of Emperor Chehu Wang who first dreamt of the birth of Buddha in a realm to the west (Loo. {'a}, 2).
211 dkrong bskyed|(tong-ke) SANST of instantaneous birth; instantaneous perception. Acc. to Lex. in meditating on a certain deity, the act of perceiving him to be a reality instantaneously is called {dkrong bskyed}.
211 dkyel|+\n= {klong} the compass, extent, bulk of anything: {nam mkha'i dkyel} the compass of the heavens: {rgya mtsho'i dkyel} the stretch of sea: {dkyel che} = {dkyel che ba} spacious; of wide capacity (Oag. 5).
211 dzA ri khaNDa|‡ n. of an Indian province: {ma ga dha dang mi ring ba'i lhor dza ri khaNDa zer ba'i yul chen po yod/} there is a large province to the south and not far from Magadha called Jari khanda (Dsam. 35).
211 gar gdong btsan|the famous general of King {srong btsan sgam po}, who visited the capital of China and induced Emperor Taitsung to give one of the princesses imperial in marriage to his sovereign, about 630 A.D.
211 glo spir|n. of kind of shield: {kul dkar phub ni rab la zho lnga ste/_glo spir zho re phub skor zho phyed yin/} the best Kul-dkar shield costs five sho and that of Glo-spir cost a sho for each disk on it (Jig.).
211 gnangs|the day after tomorrow; {sang gnangs} tomorrow and the day after tomorrow; {gnangs su} on the day after tomorrow; {sang 'gro gnangs 'gro yod pa yin} tomorrow or the day after tomorrow I must be off (Jä.).
211 gsob|SANST; hollow, empty, bloated; without substance. {gsob gsob} stuffed, spongy.\n\n(EEE The original has {gsob bsob} for {gsob gsob} above, but the transliteration "gsob-gsob" indicates the proper spelling.)
211 gsod byed|SANST, SANST 1. killer, murderer, {gsod byed rngon pa} the murderous huntsman. 2. SANST, SANST the lord of death, the evil one, Mara. {gsod byed kyi gnas} SANST slaughter house, the place of execution.
211 gting skyes|n. of a district of Tibet immediately to the north of the Kanglachen pass. It is known under the name of Tio-kye-Jong or {gzar gting skyes rdzong}; also we hear {gting skyes pa} a native of Ting-kye.
211 g.yar khral|+\n= {khral}, {sho gam} or {dpya} (Moon.) tax, revenue, rent, but generally capitation tax.\n\n(EEE The original gives the transliteration of the headword as "gyar-kkhral" which is clearly in error.)
211 gzhan smod|SANST a slanderer, cynic; SANST the slandering others; {gzhan smod byed pa} to slander others: {bdag bstod gzhan smod byed cing 'thab rtsod byed} praising self and slandering others produces quarrels.
211 hUM|œ×î-\n= {khro bo'i sngags} as a mystic expression of wrath from the lips of a frightful deity. The Tantrik lama also in vanquishing an evil spirit or an inimical god uses the expression Hum to terrorize him.
211 kar shubs|(abbr. of {dkar yol gyi shubs}) the cover of a china tea-cup, generally made of iron, brass or silver: {kar shubs la bre bcu} (Rtsii.) "for the cover of a tea-cup made of silver (the price is) 10 bre."
211 kha brda'|= {skad cha} verbal utterance: {bu mo'i mig mthong yang ma mthong ba ltar byas nas kha brda' mi byed} although he had beheld the girl's eyes, he acted as if he had not seen her and gave no spoken sign.
211 'khur du thogs te|taking up in the order to carry; taking on one's back; {lag par khur byes} in W. to hold in one's hand (Jä.); {sems la 'khur ba} to bear in mind; {'khur thag} girth or rope; strap for carrying.
211 khyad par can|special; specially good; superior, excellent, capital: {khyad par can gyi mdzad pa gnyis} the two special achievements or exploits (Yig.): {bla ma khyad par can cig} an excellent spiritual teacher.
211 lam log|erroneous (Jä.). Also SANST, wrong ways, perverse ways, i.e., heretical doctrines. There are mentioned twenty-two heretical doctrines all of which are opposed to the doctrine of Buddha (K. d. {na}, 323).
211 mchod pa'i sprin|SANST ({mchod pa'i tshogs sprin}) ["a cloud of worship" described in the Bodhi. II, to be a magnificent mode of worship in which incenses, lamps, garlands of flowers, etc., are profusely used]S.
211 me bzhi skyes|1. SANST. 2. an epithet of Vphaspati (Moon.) [Bphaspati or Jupiter is so called because he was born when the moon was in the mansion of Prakphalguni or Purvaphalguni (the eleventh constellation)]S.
211 mgal ba|jaw-bone; {ya mgal} the upper jaw-bone; {mgal ba} or {ma mgal} the lower jaw-bone. In colloq. both jaws together are called {ya le ma le}. {mgal chag} a broken jaw-bone; {mgal bud} a dislocated jaw-bone.
211 paN Di ta'i zhva|‡ the kind of mitre-shaped cap which Atisa and Tsongkhapa used to wear: {thams cad kyang paN Di ta'i zhva nga rgyal med pa gsol ba} they all wore the pandit's cap without showing vanity (A. 22).
211 'phags pa khye'u snang ba bstan pa|the Sutras delivered by Buddha to a number of infants whereby, though left in a lonely house in the wilderness, they were not disturbed by wild beasts, etc. (K. d. {nga}, 421).
211 rdzi ba|pf. {brdzis} or {rdzis}, fut. {brdzi}, imp. {brdzis} or {rdzis}, 1. to pound, stamp, to knead; to tread down; {gal te tsher ma brdzis na} if I should tread upon a thorn. 2. to oppress, to distress (Jä.).
211 rgyag pa|another form for {rgyab pa}, used esp. in C., to throw, cast, fling; {mda' rgyag pa} to shoot arrows; {dgon pa zhig rgyag pa} to found a monastery. Has, in general, all the significations of {'debs pa}.

212 bsil ldan sa la'i sman ljong|n. of Tibet; though the fanciful Indians who had very little knowledge of Tibet implied by that name the Himalayan regions which abound in Sâl trees and medicinal plants (Yig. k. 52).

212 chon|in W. 1. useless, to no purpose: {rin chon song} the payment has been useless, thrown away; gen. adv. {chon la} gratuitously, in vain, for nothing. 2. tent: {chon thag} tent-rope; {chon phur} tent-peg (Jä.).

212 'gong po rdo|or {pha wang long bu} a kind of stone of liver colour, believed to be sacred to the God Damchen who rides on a goat—the peculiarity of this stone being that it breaks in cube-like pieces (Sman. 404).

212 'jam dpal rgya mtsho|n. of the eighth Dalai Lama of Lhasa who died in the year 1805, aged 46. From the birth of Tsongkhapa to the 20th year of the Dalai Lama Hjam-dpal rgya-mtsho 420 years elapsed (Loo. {'a} 16).

213 'chir ba|evidently a form of {cir ba} to press, to squeeze. {'tshir ba} has pf. {btsir}, fut. {gtsir}, to press, to wring, &c.; {'chir ba} and {cir ba} being mere corruptions of the foregoing, though Jä. has them.
213 ci la|SANST why? wherefore? {ci la ci la} why? for what? {ci la ma rag par chas pa/} gone without being obstructed; {ci la yang} SANST for whatever; {ci la yod} SANST why is this? whence? {ci las} SANST from what?
213 du ma|SANST, SANST many; also various, several; {zhag tu ma} many days: {du mar phye} it divided itself into several (parts); {lan du mang} many a time, often. Occurs for "many" in Mil. Gurbum 79b. 2. and 182a. 3.
213 'grang ba|(dang-wa) 1. to number; to count, v. {bgrang ba}. 2. to satisfy with food; to satiate; {'grangs rjes} after having eaten one's fill; {sha ba bsad pas mi 'grangs te} not yet having enough of deer killing.

213 'jil li|= {khri'u shing} a chair, wooden stool; also = {'ja' ris} colours of the rainbow: {rdzings kyi kha khyer las 'jil li byas nas} (A. 18) a seat was furnished him by his being carried on the deck of a vessel.

213 pad ma'i rtsa ba|or {sdong po} SANST the lotus-root or stalk [lotus fibre]S.\n\nSyn. {chu skyes rtsa ba}; {chu yi tsher ma}; {pad rtsa li}; {pad shing rtsa ba}; {rkang pa}; {ngar pa}; {yu ba}; {pad sdong} (Moon.).
213 phu rtsa gye mo|n. of a village in Stod-luo situated N. W. of Lhasa, the birth-place of Hbrom-ston Rgyal-wahi hbyuo-gnas: {'brom ston rgyal ba'i 'byung gnas skyid shod stod lung phu rtsa gye mo na} (Loo. {za}, 2).
213 phyen|= {'og rlung dri ma} (vulg. in Sikk. and W. pronounced as phen) wind, flatulence: {nam phyed phru gu dra phyen btang} at midnight the child let go a wind (Dag. 4); {phyen shor song} a wind has escaped (Jä.).
213 ri rab|SANST the centre of the world and king of mountains, the fabulous Sumeru or golden mountain; also called {ri rab lhun po}, {gser gyi ri}, {ri rgyal}, {ri bo mchog rab}, {rin chen rngul brtsegs lha'i ri bo}.
213 shun pa|= {pags pa} SANST, SANST bark, rind, peel, skin; {shun kog} = {shun pags} the last expression being also used of the skin of animals (Lex.). {shun pa rjes pa} SANST to cast off or change skin as snakes do.
213 spyan 'bebs|= {spyan bltar} inspection: {legs nyes kyi gzigs rtogs zhus pa} to ask for inspection of a work or thing to ascertain its quality and defects; also to display articles of merchandise for sale (Rtsii.).
213 than bya|lit. the bird of drought, i.e., of ominous appearance and cry, defined as {'ug pa dang srin bya sogs ltas ngan gyi skad 'don pa'i bya} the owl and other monster birds the cry of which prognosticates evil.
213 ting ting|1. is an auxiliary ({tshig grogs}) to another word to intensify its meaning ({nus skyed byed pa} to emphasize it); {nag ting ting} intensely black, jet black. 2. acc. to Jä. clean, well-swept (Ld.; Ts.).
213 yon gyi gnas pa|= {spyin gnas} or {mchod gnas} an officer or sacrificer (Moon.).\n\nSyn. {yon sogs 'gyed pa'i ming}; {brims pa}; {bkram pa}; {nye bar 'gyed}; {'grems pa}; {gtong ba}; {spyin pa}; {byin pa} (Moon.).
214 bag tsam|nyung tsam or {cha tsam}, SANST; a little; {nor bag tsam re} each a little money (Mil.); {dang ga bag tsam bde} the appetite is growing a little better; {bag tsam pa} slight, insignificant, trifling (Jä.).
214 bar gras|= {'bring gi gras} of the middle class, quality, or size. {bar zhib} barley flour of second quality (Rtsii.); {bar g.yu} = {g.yu 'bring} turquoise of second quality; {bar sha} second quality meat (Rtsii.).
214 brdeg pa|SANST 1. altern. form and fut. of {rdeg pa} also seems = beaten to death. 2. = {za ba} to eat, eating.\n\n(EEE moved from its incorrect position in the original to here for proper usage of the dictionary.)
214 chu gter mu khyud|SANST an island.\n\n(EEE The original gives the Tibetan headword as {chu gter mu khyad} but the transliteration "chu-gter mu-khyud" is correct and the headword above has been changed accordingly.)
214 deb pa|1. accounts cast into one place or shape; {lo rgyus sogs gcig tu deb pa} to cast all accounts or records into one place. 2. acc. to Sch.: poultice, cataplasm, applied to sores and inflamed parts of the body.
214 dzi li dzva la|‡ cancer; acc. to some authors it is {gnyan nad} or plague; acc. to others a fearful kind of burning leprosy: {dzi li dzva la'i nad rgyu chod} stops the progress of the disease dsi-li dswala (A. 19).
214 gshung ba|to rebuke, to blame, reproach; {shub bur dmod pa byed pa dang skyon brjod pa} to blame in a whisper, i.e., behind a person's back and to find fault with. {gshungs pa} = {smod pa} a curse, rebuke, censure.
214 gzas pa|1. to set about, to be on the point, to prepare for; generally used with termin. case of infin. mood. {rko bar gzas so} prepared, began to dig out. 2. to brandish, = {brdeg par brtsams pa} to begin to wave.
214 khams bde ba|or {gzugs bde ba} good health; healthy constitution; the happy state both of the body and the mind: {rje btsun gyi khams bde lags sam} is your reverence well? {khyed khams bde 'am} are you well? (Jä.).
214 khegs pa|I: to obstruct; close: {mngal sgo nges par khegs par 'gyur ro/} (the medicine) will certainly obstruct the passage of the womb.\n\nII: {mun pa spyi} a general name for darkness, gloom or obscurity (Moon.).
214 mdang|or {mdang dgong} yesterday evening; {mda' sang} SANST yesterday: {mdang sang rang yong ba yin} came only yesterday (Oag. 39) {mdang sum} last night: {mdang sum bdag gi rmi lam na} last night in my dream, etc.
214 mi skyod pa|is the 2nd Dhyani Buddha, equivalent to Akshobhya of the Sanskrit Buddhists and to Ulü-küde-lükchi of Mongol Buddhists. In Tantrik images he is painted blue and clasps in his arms a Yum or Sakti female.
214 ngad bzang|good smell: {phebs tshogs ga bur gyi ngad bzang yang nas yang du yod pa khyen khyen/} let the breeze of your letters laden with the aroma of camphor come again and again to me, i.e., pray write me often.
214 nges par kun sbyin|SANST removal; {nges par 'gro ba kun la sbyin pa'am/} giving in charity to all living beings; {yang rang gi dngos po kun nges par sbyin na/} or consists in giving over one's properties to others.
214 'phags rigs|the noble and venerable brotherhood or order.\n\nSyn. {rigs chen}; {rigs bzang}; {skyes bu mchog}; {skyes bu dam pa}; {tshangs par spyod pa}; {khrims la gnas pa}; {nags na gnas pa}; {dge slong} (Moon.).
214 shum pa|pf. {bshums} or {shums}, fut. {bshum}, imp. {shum} or {shums} to weep, shudder: {ma shum mdzod} do not weep! {ngu shum} weeping, lamentation. {grang shum byed pa} to tremble or shiver with cold, to shudder.
214 'thig pa|1. vb. n., pf. {'thigs} to drop, to fall in drops, to drip from: {khrag ma 'thigs par} without any blood dropping out. 2. vb. a., pf. {gtigs}, fut. {btig} of cause to fall in drops, to distill, etc. (Jä.).
214 yon po|1. v. {yo ba} (Jä.). 2. = {drang po min pa} also {'khyog pa} crooked, not straight (Zam. 11).\n\nSyn. {kyog po}; {yon kyog}; {gcu bo}; {mi drang ba}; {'chus pa}; {sgyur ba}; {'khyog po}; {kyag kyog} (Moon.).
214 zhang|n. of a district of Tsang N. of Tashi-lhunpo. {zhang rgyal ba'i yon tan} n. of a celebrated Lama of Tibet belonging to Shang (Deb. {ga}, 3); {zhang rtags} a kind of long knife manufactured in Shang (Jig. 31).
215 bro|1. SANST, SANST dance; entertainment, amusement. {bro mkhan} SANST a dancer; {zhabs bro mdzad pa} to dance as a manifestation of gladness and mirth; {bro gar} SANST dramatic performance, drama, play. 2. an oath.
215 bstod pa|1. ({phur pa la thag pas ra lug rta sogs btags pa}) to tether cattle such as horses, sheep, goats, etc.; {thag pas bstod} to tether with a string (Situ. 75). 2. eulogium, expression of praise, v. {stod pa}.
215 bud shing|= {me shing} fire-wood, fuel, also dried dung used as such; {bud shing bshag pa} to split or chop wood. {bud shing bcu pa} ({mar me}) SANST a torch, a light; lit. flambeau consisting of ten pieces of wood.
215 'byid pa|= {'drid pa} (Oag. 51). pf. {byid} or {phyid} 1. to glide, to slip; to disappear, to slip away: {mi tshe 'byid pa} human life passes away. 2. = {'dang ba} or {skyel ba}: {lto gos 'byid pa} to earn a living.
215 'di ru|here, into this place, at this place. {'di ru shog} come hither! {'dir} SANST here; = {'di na} SANST at this place: {chos kyi rgyal po 'di lhags sam} has the Dharma Raja (with his retinue) come here? (A. 23).
215 dung mkhan|v. {dung bzo ba}.\n\n(EEE {dung bzo ba} is not found elsewhere in the dictionary. A {dung mkhan} is a maker of ornaments/jewellery from white conch. {dung bzo ba} would be artisanship concerning conches.)
215 'gal zla|= {'gal ba'i grogs} or {mi mthun pa'i grogs} an enemy: {rang dang mi mthun pa'i 'gal zla rnams dang bsdongs nas} having joined with such of the enemy as were not in agreement with one another (Khrid. 116.).
215 g.yer pa|= {g.yer ba}: {mi bdag g.yer pa'i lugs bzhin du} SANST [in the manner of a proud king]S. (A.K. 1-32).\n\n(EEE The original gives the transliteration of the headword as "ggyer-pa" which is clearly in error.)
215 ka lA pa|‡ SANST 1. an aggregate of many accomplishments; an accumulation of excellent and wonderful properties in one place or thing (Lexx.). 2. The Buddhist Utopia; the capital of the fabulous kingdom of Sambhala.
215 kha lo sgyur pa|or {kha lo sgyur ba} SANST, SANST; SANST, SANST, SANST; {kha lo sgyur mkhan} one who steers; also a governor, a driver, a charioteer. See especially in narrative of early life of the Buddha in Dulwa.
215 khol mo|1. {g.yog mo} SANST maid servant. 2. a coarse sort of blanket usually given to slaves in C. (Schtr.). 3. mowed corn; a swath (Jä.). 4. among the herdsmen called Dog-pa, a bellows made of an entire goat skin.
215 mu bzhi|the four limits: (1) {skyed 'gag} birth and death; (2) {rtag chad} immortality and annihilation; (3) {yod med} existence and non-existence; (4) {snang stong} light or phenomenon and voidity (which is chaos).
215 muNDa rI|‡ SANST n. of an aquatic plant; {se bA la dang}, {dza lo ka dang}, {sbal pa'i tshil gyis rkang pa dag mnyes nas chu shing gi lo ma dkris nas mdas 'bar ba'i steng du tshig par mi 'gyur ro} (K. g. {ca}, 356).
215 ri skyes ma|also {rir skyes} or {ri la skyes} lit. born in the mountain; SANST the daughter of Himalaya, but acc. to Tibetan authors: one of the names of Draupadi the joint wife of the five Pandava brothers (Moon.).
215 rmu thag|1. a cord to which little flags are attached on roofs of convents, houses etc. 2. a rope by which the ancient kings and queens of Tibet were reputed to ascend into heaven there to live with their ancestors.
215 sbyin pa po|SANST giver, alms-giver, offerer of a gift. Syn. {gtong phod}; {dpal sdug}; {sbyin rlabs can}; {shin tu sbyin byed}; {rab tu 'god}; {rab ster}; {spyod po}; {gter med mchod sbyin}; {ris med ster} (Moon.).
215 sgyu lus|1. the immaterial body of the soul while in the Bardo. 2. the animal and human body in general. inasmuch as it is only an apparent body; a phantom, when considered from a higher philosophical point of view.
215 shag ma|SANST stone or rock, gravel; {shag ma can} gravelly; {shag thang} a plain abounding with gravel. {shag rad} rocky ground; {shag rug} gravel; {shag sa} earth mixed up with pebbles, stony sterile ground (Jä.).
215 skabs gsum pa|I: SANST, SANST a god; a common name for gods possessed of the knowledge of their past and future births and also of those of others.\n\nII: a name of the celestial musician; {lha'i glu mkhan} (Moon.).

215 spos glang|1. SANST the royal elephant which in ancient India used to pick out a person as king in the place of defunct royalty. 2. SANST ['always exuding ichor'; an elephant in rut; n. of Airavata, and of Ganesa]S.

216 bags|+\n= {rims} slowly, gradually, one after another, by degrees; {bags kyis} = {rims kyis}: {bags kyis ri bo bags kyis 'dzegs} climbed up the hill slowly, i.e., by degrees (A. 131). {bags kyis gzhol} = {chu klung}.

216 bya spu non pa|to pat on the back; to keep in order, not to disturb any arrangement: {bya spu non gyi rgyab skyor} patting on the back in the way of encouragement as if gently touching the plumes of a bird (Yig. k.).
216 'byin byed|({'dam}) 1. mire, mud in which the feet sink. 2. that which is drowned or sunk—or caused to sink (S. Lex.). {'byin byed} = {chu rnyog ma can} dirty water, water containing mud and other impurities (Moon.).
216 dar rtse mdo|Darchendo, otherwise Ta-chien-lu, situated in the south-easternmost corner of Tibet and practically out of all Tibetan jurisdiction. It is the transport place from whence brick tea is brought into Tibet.
216 dpag|measure: {dpag med} or {dpag yas} measureless, immeasurable. {dpag thag} measuring string or tape; {dpag pa} SANST fathom; {dpag byas} SANST measurable; {dpag bral} SANST, SANST n. of a number. {dpag 'byams} id.
216 'dzar ba|1. taking dinner at midday. 2. pf. {bzar}, fut. {gzar}, to suspend, to hang up, to fling across or over, to put over one's shoulder. 3. to dress carelessly or in a loose manner, to huddle on clothes or rags.
216 grag pa|or {grags pa} 1. = {sgra 'byind pa} SANST the tone; pitch of a sound or voice. 2. fame; noise; rumour; talk. 3. the principal or most distinguished amongst several persons (Jä.). 4. occasionally = {'grag pa}.
216 'gum pa|+\nto die (of natural death, of disease): {de'i ring la lo tsA ba'i 'khor yang phal cher tshad pas 'gum} at that time most of those of the attendants of the Lo-tsa-wa who were smitten with fever died (A. 65).

216 khams tshan|this term is applied to the quarters in a monastery reserved for the accommodation of the monks of a particular section of people or of some special community or those coming from one particular locality.
216 khri srong lde btsan|the celebrated King of Tibet who formally introduced Buddhist monarchism into Tibet, erected the great monastery of Samye, and caused numerous Buddhist sacred books to be translated into Tibetan.

216 kye phang pa|n. of an idol of the Nyingma sect, consisting, like most of the popular idols in Tibet, of an enchanted stick or log decked with rags, but much dreaded and said to be identical with Pe-dkar Gyalpo (Jä.).
216 men|an ornament, piece of finery (Mil.). {men rtsi} (Chinese) a coloured silk handkerchief. {men hri} a kind of fur; {men hri dmar po'i slog spags} a fur-coat of red men-hri (is mentioned as the vesture of the gods).
